main event: A circular red sphere with sparks was observed in Oscoda, Michigan on January 13, 1954.
interesting points: The object was visible for approximately 1.3 minutes,It created a flash that outlined clouds,The flight of the object was towards the east,Reports suggested the object could be a balloon, meteor, or aircraft,There were other personnel who observed vapor trails related to the sighting.
witness description: acting intelligence officer from 12th Weather Squadron
